< About />

About UB Hacking


Location

UB Hacking will be taking place throughout Davis Hall on University at Buffalo's North Campus. Parking is available in the parking lots next to the building. If you are from out of town and have any questions getting here feel free to contact us.

Davis Hall, University at Buffalo, White Road, Buffalo, NY 14260

Philosophy & History

Hackathons are really awesome events where developers can get together to build incredible ideas. UB Hacking is a hackathon for college students, and not just students from SUNY Buffalo or even just the Buffalo area. We want to bring awesome college hackers together to work together to create amazing web, mobile, and hardware hacks.

In 2012, UB Hacking was born. We had 45 hackers from UB CSE that hacked for 24 hours straight then demoed their apps to community judges. UB Hacking 2012 was centered around this idea of "Making An Impact" which seemed quite fitting for the inaugural event. The winning teams took home awesome tech prizes and services. The winning team from last year is currently working on turning their idea into a viable company!


Organizers

Nick DiRienzo @nickdirienzo - Github

Nick is a sophmore in CS, and will be a SWE Intern at Google for Summer 2013. Not only that, but he is the President of UB ACM. Having started UB Hacking as a freshman, Nick strives to get others involved in working on awesome projects.

Joe Peacock @joeapeacock - Github

Joe is an awesome frontend developer, and also a freshman studying Computer Engineering. He loves hackathons and hacking on cool projects. He designed the website and all of the UB Hacking swag. Find him on Twitter and GitHub.
